snippet: The governor is going after the state’s high-tax image, and wants homeowners and renters as well as manufacturers outside the New York City area to see relief.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo announces sweeping $2 billion tax relief proposal, a catchall of cuts for property and business owners, renters and upstate manufacturers; says state will be able to pay for tax cuts because his administration is tightly controlling increases in spending and expected growing surpluses in coming years.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and JESSE McKINLEY

lead_paragraph: The governor is going after the state’s high-tax image, and wants homeowners and renters as well as manufacturers outside the New York City area to see relief.

headline.main: Cuomo Proposes $2 Billion in Tax Cuts
headline.print_headline: Cuomo, Seeking to Alter State’s High-Tax Image, Says He Wants $2 Billion in Cuts
